main_definition: To give or allow freely, without expectation of return; to officially approve or authorize something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To award money as a gift.
meanings_and_examples.example: The city council decided to grant $500 to the local charity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give permission or approval for something requested.
meanings_and_examples.example: After reviewing his proposal, they granted him permission to proceed with his project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To release (a prisoner) on parole after serving part of the prison sentence.
meanings_and_examples.example: The judge decided to grant early parole to the inmate who showed good behavior while incarcerated.
After a long debate, she finally granted his request for a day off work.
